column1: Artificial Intelligence in the Biosciences MSc
column5: Applications of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools in the biosciences are rapidly expanding and bioscientists skilled in the methods and thinking in AI are in short supply. This programme aims to prepare bioscience graduates to become leaders in the application of AI methods in professional bioscience Research and Development workplace environments. It has been specifically designed to make AI and related computational techniques (machine learning, analysis of large data sets) accessible to biology and biomedical graduate students without any prior experience in computational methods.
column7: Home: £14,250 Overseas: £26,750 EU/EEA/Swiss students: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
